resources.string: This app has voice guidance by way of text translations and voice commands courtesy of volunteers at https://hosted.weblate.org/projects/your-local-weather. The app dev cannot guarantee they are correct - you accept this by using the app. To use it you need TTS (Text-to-speech) installed and guidance turned on in the settings, where you can set your own voice commands.
This application uses Open-Meteo (https://open-meteo.com) as its weather source from now on, as openweathermap.org is ending its free service in June 2024.

Access to the Mozilla location service expired as of 1.3.2020. The app is forced to use the Andorid system for location coordinates discovery. The address is still resolved by Nominatim. Please consider this when using the app.

Starting from Android 10, fine-grained access to location is needed to get info about the connected GSM/LTE network. Grant permission to fetch location in the background too (if you want your location all the time).
The app will ask you to turn off battery optimization to update location, weather or track location by accelerometer in the background.
The application requires background location permission to get the weather by location where you actually are. If you agree you should select the option on the next screen:
The app is set to update location. Access to it is needed. Go to device settings and switch the location on or switch app location updates off.
The app needs permission to update location using GPS.
The app needs a permission to update location by Wi-Fi and GSM networks.
Permission to read information from the device is needed to update location using Wi-Fi and GSM networks. This fetches info about which GSM base stations the device is connected to.
Permissions are not yet granted - click the location symbol in the app
Access expired. Upgrade the app, please.
Your Open-Meteo ApiKey is not registered.
You are not allowed to have more than %1$d locations at the moment.
Adjusting the app to your needs, you can choose update strategy next. \nDiverting from the default of updating when location changes, you can select Don\'t update location.

You can choose the location method - the System one uses Google services to get the location by networks (cell and Wi-Fi networks). The Local MLS and Nominatim option uses Mozilla location service to get location coordinates and Nominatim service to get location names. The second option requires phone call permissions to fetch info about the cellular network. The preferred option is preselected.

Some phones don\'t report connected cells correctly unless the display is on. The preferred option (with display switched on) has the disadvantage that the phone switches the display on for several seconds. This has a small impact on battery life. Start with it on, and try switching it off and see if the location still updates.
You can reduce data usage by caching found locations. Locations are then stored in the app. They are not sent or stored other places in the network.

This concludes the guide. You can find other settings in the Settings menu (for example language, units etc.). 
The next screen will explain the requested permissions and give you the option to request them. 
 
Enjoy the app.

The app determines location using cellular network (BTS), Wi-Fi, and if those fail; GPS to show local weather, in turn getting the coordinates from the Mozilla location service. The application needs at least: one base station of GSM network or two reachable wifi networks or any combination of GSM and Wi-Fi networks. Using the widget on your phone or tablet, you can see your location and current weather on the main screen. Location updates can be periodic, (ex. hourly) or the app can use the accelerometer to detect movement of greater distance than a value. Carried in your pocket, the distance increases faster. You can switch location updates off - only weather is then updated. The app updates location and weather in specified intervals. You can for example set update period to one hour o\'clock. The weather is updated immediately after location is, or when the screen is turned on - but not more often then once per 15 minutes (and when weather is not updated in the last 15 minutes). These information are used to get location coordinates by Mozilla location service. The app tries to use GPS when location is not available from cell network and Wi-Fi networks. Location coordinates are used to get address by Nominatim service. The address is used in the app or widget. The app uses Open-Meteo (https://open-meteo.com) service to get current weather.

The main app contains an overview of the current weather. You can update the weather using the refresh button in the app panel or by sliding down. You can find the update location button next to the refresh weather button. This button is only available when location 0 is enabled (location 0 is intended for automated update of location).

Next to the update location button, there is a location management button (magnifier icon). You can manage locations available in the app and widgets. There is one location (Location 0) available by default - this is intended for automatic location updates. You can find enable/disable button when you slide this location leftwards. You can also add location manually. When you click on the + button you can pick up your location on map. You can also delete the location with the Delete button - which is accessible when you slide location leftwards.

You can find weather forecast on the next screen (select the next screen in menu or swipe left to right). Weather forecast is updated by update button or when you enter the screen (but not more than one update per hour).
The third screen contains weather forecast displayed by graphs.

The app has three widgets available, containing some common values of the current weather (for example temperature). Some values are unique to the specific widget (for example sunset). There is a time of the last update on right corner of every widget. You can see what has been updated since last time (when you have enabled this option in the settings menu). You can find update button next to the last updated time. When you press this button, the weather (and the location when selected update location option) is updated unconditionally. The last option in widgets is changing of location - when you press on current location text the location changes to the next one.
These options have influence on the whole app.
Temperature - You can select temperature unit, Wind - You can select the wind speed unit and Pressure - You can select the unit for pressure. Values are recalculated using these options.
Hide weather description - the description of current weather is hidden. You can only see current weather by the changing icon.

Update period for location (Location 0) - you can set update period for location 0 - location 0 has the ability to update location according to cell-, Wi-Fi networks and GPS. When you select update By accelerometer the app uses that to detect movement. From this, distance is calculated. When the distance limit is reached, and no update has happened in 15 minutes, the location and current weather is updated. When the app cannot fetch your location, you can see unknown location label in the widget. When the app has no location state, it will try again in 5 minutes. You can also select location update based on time intervals in Update period for weather (Location 1,2,3...) - where you can set weather to update for manually discovered locations.

When you check Switch GPS on when necessary option, the app will try to find your location using cell or wifi networks. When the location cannot be found using network services, the app turns GPS on for a several seconds to get the location.
Location and address source \nYou can select where the app gets the location and address from.

Local MLS and Nominatim - The app gets location and geographical coordinates from the Mozilla location services. Nominatim services fetches the address from those coordinates. You can contribute to future improvements to MLS by installing Mozilla Stumbler (available at https://play.google.com/store/apps/details\?id=org.mozilla.mozstumbler). Get info about current active and available network base stations from the cell network by granting the phone call permission. Wi-Fi networks around you are used to guess your location more precisely.
System - The application gets location and address by system services in Android (usually with Google location services).
These menu options sets the language, theme of main application and icon set used in the application and widgets.

Notifications \nWhen you selects notifications option, application updates current weather periodically. Current weather is put into notifications area then. You can enable vibration also - application vibrate when updated.

To save network traffic and speed-up location update you can switch Cache locations on. This cache stores geographic coordinates and an address. The application has to call network resolution service regardless of this setting. But the call to Nominatim address resolution takes place just in the case the address is not in cache. When you switch the Cache locations option on, addresses that you\'ve visited, are stored in the application. No information from the cache is sent outside of the application.

Next to the cache location option (checkbox) there is a setting for The age of cached values. Every stored address has a timestamp. When the timestamp is older then value set in The age of cached values, the app calls Nominatim to refresh the record.
You can clear the cache of addresses with the Clear cache button.
You can see several last rows of the cached values in the Information about cache section. You can see total number of rows also.
Widget settings contains configuration options for all widgets.
When you enable Show labels in widget, you can see labels instead of icons for weather condition values.
You can control the widget background with the Widget theme option.
When you select on graph to show rain/snow values next to wind and temperature (in bars) the value is calculated as log10. The maximum value of (unvisible) axis is about 160 mm (or 6.3 inches) then.

Wake up strategy is there to overcome buggy vendor implementations of the Android Aurora services. Selecting No wake up, should update the location correctly. \nIf not, try Wake up CPU only to read cell- and Wi-Fi network state. \nWake up with display turns the screen on for several seconds during the location update as a last resort.

When an update of location and current weather is performed you can see the status of the update next to the update time in widget. You can control what is displayed by the Display update summary option. The explanation of the most advanced option follows:
There are options to enable debugging into log file. This option is useful when there is some trouble with application.
Location is not initialized. Click on location circle first.
An error has occurred. Try later.
Show graph in native resolution (when the graph is too small)
System to get location, Nominatim to get address (recommended)

- - going to update location and/or weather 
. - location is not reachable, updating weather based on last location 
W - weather only updated 
L - location only updated 
G - location from GPS and weather updated 
N - location from network and weather updated 
B - access to Open-Meteo service has been banned, try to update weather later, please 
E - the access token for Open-Meteo service expired. You need to upgrade the application to get access again

W - only weather updated 
L - only location updated 
G - location from GPS and weather updated 
N - location from network and weather updated 
Ni - location from cellular network and weather updated, location discovered by Mozilla location service 
B - access to Open-Meteo service has been banned, please try to update the weather later 
E - the access token for Open-Meteo service has expired. Install a later version of the app to regain access
When location gets stuck during device sleep, you can try to wake it up when it is looking for a cellular network
After specified amount of time cached values will be removed
Tap on map to get desired location and wait to get address resolved.
Please click the refresh button to update the weather first.

The app sends text commands to the TTS system (text-to-speech), which converts it to a voice. It is usually present on the system by default. If not, or the installed TTS doesn\'t support your desired language, install one from an app store (for example: https://search.f-droid.org/\?q=TTS ).
Your app locale is not supported by your TTS (text-to-speech) system. Select a guidance language from the list of supported ones below.
Your app locale is not supported by your TTS (text-to-speech) system. Go to \"Guidance language settings\" in the top right.
When a Bluetooth device is connected
Number of days for the forecast
Location permissions needed to determine city
Current weather description language and the address will change with the next update, or you can force it manually.
After a specified amount of time the log file will be recreated
